SENT.plain: A 52-year-old man presented to the emergency department with dysphasia and a headache after scuba diving
He was treated initially for decompression sickness
Subsequent workup revealed bilateral internal carotid artery dissection
The risk factors, presenting symptoms, diagnosis, and treatment of internal carotid artery dissection are reviewed
The importance of considering unusual causes of neurologic deficits after scuba diving is emphasized
